Smart Meeting Room
  • Project API Documentation
  • View page source

Project API Documentation

This documentation covers the four microservices that make up the Smart Meeting Room system.

Users Service

API Endpoints

Data Models

class users_service.models.User(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a user in the system.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the user.

  • full_name (str) – Full name of the user.

  • username (str) – Unique username for the user.

  • email (str) – Unique email address of the user.

  • password (str) – Hashed password for the user.

  • role (str) – Role of the user (e.g., admin, user).

email

id
password
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

username

Reviews Service

API Endpoints

Data Models

class reviews_service.models.Review(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a user review for a specific room

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the review.

  • user_id – ID of the user who wrote the review.

  • room_id (int) – ID of the room being reviewed.

  • rating (int) – Rating given by the user (1-5).

  • comment (str) – Comment provided by the user.

  • timestamp (datetime) – Date and time when the review was created.

  • is_flagged (bool) – Moderation status.

comment
id
is_flagged
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

Rooms Service

API Endpoints

Data Models

class rooms_service.models.Room(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a meeting room in the system.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the room.

  • name (str) – Name of the room.

  • capacity (int) – Maximum number of people in the room.

  • equipment (str) – Equipment available in the room.

  • location (str) – Location of the room.

query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

Bookings Service

API Endpoints

Data Models

class bookings_service.models.Booking(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a booking reservation for a room.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the booking.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user who made the booking.

  • room_id (int) – ID of the room being booked.

  • start_time (datetime) – Start date and time of the booking.

  • end_time (datetime) – End date and time of the booking.

end_time
id
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.
